Package core

Interface HlaSaveRestoreListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HlaSaveRestoreListener.Adapter
    public interface HlaSaveRestoreListener
    Listeners for saving and restoring the federation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  HlaSaveRestoreListener.Adapter
      An abstract adapter class that implements the HlaSaveRestoreListener interface with empty methods.
      static class  HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaRestoreFailure
      Enum used to describe restore failure reasons.
      static class  HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaSaveFailure
      Enum used to describe save failure reasons.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void federationNotRestored​(HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaRestoreFailure restoreFailureReason, boolean localRestoreWasSuccessful, HlaLogicalTime localRestoredTime, boolean wasAdvancing)
      Federation was not restored, one or more federates could not restore its state.
      void federationNotSaved​(HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaSaveFailure saveFailureReason)
      Federation was not saved, one ore more federates could not save its state.
      void federationRestored​(HlaLogicalTime restoredTime, boolean wasAdvancing)
      All federates in the federation has successfully restored its respective state.
      void federationSaved()
      All federates in the federation has successfully saved its respective state.
      boolean performFederateRestore​(java.lang.String label)
      The federate is about to restore its state, if true is returned the HlaWorld will restore its internal state.
      boolean performFederateSave​(java.lang.String label, HlaLogicalTime saveTime)
      The federate should save its state, if true is returned the HlaWorld will save its internal state.

    • Method Detail

      • performFederateSave

        boolean performFederateSave​(java.lang.String label,
                            HlaLogicalTime saveTime)
        The federate should save its state, if true is returned the HlaWorld will save its internal state.
        Parameters:
        label - label used to identify the save state
        saveTime - logical time when the federation should be saved
        Returns:
        true if the save was successful

      • federationSaved

        void federationSaved()
        All federates in the federation has successfully saved its respective state.

      • federationNotSaved

        void federationNotSaved​(HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaSaveFailure saveFailureReason)
        Federation was not saved, one ore more federates could not save its state.
        Parameters:
        saveFailureReason - reason for the failure

      • performFederateRestore

        boolean performFederateRestore​(java.lang.String label)
        The federate is about to restore its state, if true is returned the HlaWorld will restore its internal state.
        Parameters:
        label - label used to identify the restore state
        Returns:
        true if the restore was successful

      • federationRestored

        void federationRestored​(HlaLogicalTime restoredTime,
                        boolean wasAdvancing)
        All federates in the federation has successfully restored its respective state.

        If the federate was not in the advancing time state and the save/restore was time managed, the federate might need to wait until the granted time state is reached.

        Parameters:
        restoredTime - logical time when the federation was saved
        wasAdvancing - true if the local federate was in the advancing time state when the restore was performed
        See Also:
        HlaSaveRestoreManager.awaitGrantedStateAfterRestore(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)

      • federationNotRestored

        void federationNotRestored​(HlaSaveRestoreListener.HlaRestoreFailure restoreFailureReason,
                           boolean localRestoreWasSuccessful,
                           HlaLogicalTime localRestoredTime,
                           boolean wasAdvancing)
        Federation was not restored, one or more federates could not restore its state. The federates that failed to restore its state are now in an undefined state, this may affect the entire federation.

        If the federate was not in the advancing time state and the save/restore was time managed, the federate might need to wait until the granted time state is reached.

        Parameters:
        restoreFailureReason - reason for the failure
        localRestoreWasSuccessful - true if the local federate restore was successful
        localRestoredTime - logical time when the local federate was restored
        wasAdvancing - true if the local federate was in the advancing time state when the restore was performed
        See Also:
        HlaSaveRestoreManager.awaitGrantedStateAfterRestore(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
